intro: Knautia laxifoliata, commonly known as the slender knautia, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family, characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils, often in mountainous regions, and prefers full sun. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Knautia laxifoliata is valued in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
